(43) 172.April 23, 1943.WAR CABINET.ARRANGEMENTS TO CELEBRATE THE THIRD ANNIVERSARY OFTHE HOME GUARD.Memorandum by the Secretary of State for War.THE third anniversary of the formation of the Home Guard falls on the14th May, 1943,. and in accordance with the decisions of the War Cabinet at its meeting on the 12th April,* the following arrangements have been made tocelebrate the occasion : 1. His Majesty The King, as Colonel-in-Chief of the Home Guard, has agreed to mark the occasion by the issue of an Order of the Day. A furtherproposalt that the Home Guard should mount guard at.Buckingham Palace onthe occasion of the celebration of the anniversary is now being pursued.2. The Prime Minister has expressed his intention to broadcast on the evening of Friday, the 14th May, 1943.3. Sunday, the 16th May, 1943. will be regarded as " Home Guard Sunday."Instructions have been issued that armed parades will be held throughout thecountry on the afternoon of that day, in which both General Service and Anti-Aircraft units of the Home Guard will take part. Where possible the paradeswill be followed by displays of skill at arms, field-craft and battle drill, and theHome Guard will be assisted by the Regular Army in matters such as the loan of bands and participation with tanks and carriers.4. In London the chief feature will be a parade and march-past on the afternoon of the 16th May. The route will be as follows : Hyde Park, Constitution Hill, The Mall, Trafalgar Square, RegentStreet, Oxford Street, and return to Hyde Park.About 5,000 men will take part, and the parade will be followed by demonstrationsof weapons in one of the parks. The Secretary of State for War, with members of the Army Council, the Commander-in-Chief. Home Forces, and theGeneral Officer Commanding-in-Chief, A.A. Command, will be present. Inaddition parades have been arranged in each sector of London District, includingparades at Wembley Stadium. Blackheath and Bunhill Fields, and one sector hasarranged a service in AVestminster Abbey.5. The Minister of Information is arranging, in conjunction with me, forthe fullest publicity to be given to all activities in connection with the celebrations.P. J. G.War Office, S.W. 1.April 23, 1943.* W.M. (43) 52nd Conclusions, Minute 4.f W.M. (43) 57th Conclusions. Minute 3.[25340]
